text: Sampled from hand pump in front of De Bierkoning during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016, blend of 80% of about one-year-old and 20% of five-year-old lambic. Hazy, golden amber. Sourish-fruity, slightly funky aroma of gooseberry, quince, grains and butter. Sweetish, slightly sourish, fruity and a little funky taste of gooseberry, quince, grains and some butter, followed by a medium long, moderately tart finish. Thin to medium body, slightly astringent mouthfeel, flat. Nice!
Cloudy deep golden yellow color, flat.  Very funky medicinal aroma.  Taste has funk, straw, rotten lemon.  Interesting.
Draft at brett fest. Golden pour. Aroma of butter and tart. Taste has strange buttery grain and some tart. Mild horseblanket as well. Strange lambic.

From hand pump in front of de Bierkoning. Blend of few months old lambic with some 5 year old. Hazy orange golden with a few bubbles. Lots of diacetyl, light cheese, cobwebs, funk, apricots, quite some wood and light green leaves. Light sour and bitter. Medium bodied, no carbonation.

75cl bottle shared at a brewing day.
Thin white head. very hazy blond pour. Slight sourness. Well done.

Bottle shared thanks to a brewing buddy. Hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma has a nice funk, horse blanket, dusty cellar notes and citrus. Flavour is moderate sour. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

bottle with qc-crew, thanks guys! pours hazy/cloudy golden with a nice white cap, minimal retention and lacing. rags and old grassy sulfuric hops, minty (!), funky, lime and coriander, woodsy and dusty oak, wheat, nice orchard fruitiness. lively to average carbonation, light body, grassy-spicy and pleasantly tart finish. balanced and tasty. im impressed! this is quite delicious!

Bottle 375ml. Thx Huxxy.
Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, funk. Taste is of citrus, barnyard, acidity, lemon. Palate: Light-medium body. Medium-high carbonation. Overall: Very good. Gueuzy. Nicely blended unblended.

Bottle (375 ml). Shared by JulienHuxley, thanks!

Appearance: Hazy golden-orange with a medium easy to revive white head and some lacing.

Aroma: Quite minty with a nice funk presence, barnyard, mineral notes and light spiciness. Really enticing.

Taste: Moderately sour. Mineral notes, light funk, mild spiciness and a light minty presence.

Palate: Medium body. Good carbonation. Oaky mouthfeel. Mineral and minty finish. Quite dry. 

Overall: This feel a lot more like a gueuze than an unblended lambic, but the important is that it feels authentic and its really good. The aroma is particularly impressive with minty features similar to what can be found in aged 3 Fonteinen geuzes. Really good.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 Bottle shared by JulienHuxley, thanks man! Pours a cloudy golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of menthol (or some "fresh" spices at least) and moderately funky. Taste is moderately sour and gives out funky (cheesy) and fruity (apricot) flavors. Body is medium and carbonation fine and low to medium. Overall a really nice pseudo-lambic! Thanks again for the opportunity Julien!

Bottle shared, thanks Edo! Hazy gold pour with nice tenacious white head. Aroma is really nice, super interesting grassy aromas, old hop, minty, super hoppy, nice legit lambic funk. Taste is tart, nice funky, farmy hay flavor, bright acidity. Palate is light bodied, very dry, nice mineral carbonation. Very nice surprise.

Pours unclear blonde. Good white head. Smell is funky, some cellar tones, Rather bitter for a geuze. 
Taste is funky, dry, some oak , sour. Very complex. Less bitter than the taste would make you think. Carbonated, to my surprise, making this almost a geuze. Very nice one !

Bottle split at Bruces, thanks to Paulo, 29/01/15.
Hazed golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is lemon rind, pissy straw, earthy, funk, tangy orange, must.
Taste comprises citric tinged straw, lemon rind, herbal notes, damp hay, wood must, apple core.
Medum bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Ok.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 29th January 2015Tasting at Bruces. Thanks to the Scopester. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head.Palate is light, dry and crisp. Light wet wood and mild lemon sourness turning slightly acid. Whisper of dried fruits. Light finish. Very approachable.

Bottle via trade, shared at Bruces. Gusher! It pours hazy gold with a medium white head. The nose juicy, funky, sherbet, lemon-lime, orange, hay and mild florals. The taste is crisp, tart,acidic, lemon rind, pithy lime, good mouth-pucker, musty in the background, minerals and light floral notes. Medium body and big foamy carbonation. All comes together rather nicely. Good stuff.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Paul. Pours unclear gold with a frothy white head. The nose holds some aged grass, wood, lemony citrus, old carpets. Light sweet flavor with moderate acidity, fairly oily, some rindy citrus, grassy bitterness, damp wood. Light bodied with spritzy carbonation. Grassy and oily on the finish with damp wood, lemon peel, wet wood, some musty basement. Not bad.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 From bottle. Golden color. Only a soft citrus and oak aroma. Sour, citric flavor with vanilla. Well carbonated for a lambic.

Mix of 80% 1 year Old lambic, 20% 5 year Old lambic. Carnivale Brettanomyces  2016. Golden color. Yoghurt and citrus in the aroma and flavor. Butter. Diacetyl (7 3 7 2 14 = 3.3)

Small sample from bottle at In de Wildeman during Carinvale Brettanomyces 2014. Pours slightly hazy golden with almost no head. Aroma has some barnyard, a bit of sourness and citrus. Taste also has some barnyard, citrus, a soft to medium sourness and a dry finish. Light body, medium carbo. Nice.
Sampled from bottle @ In de Wildeman. Clear golden color, no head. Smell and taste apple, (Dutch) appelstroop, applepeel, lightly sour, pretty dry. Decent, but not my favorite beer from this brewery.

Sample from bottle @ In De Wildeman, Carnivale Brettanomyces 2014, with joes, bierkoning, theJvd & benzai. Hazy golden color. No head. Aromas: mildly sour, grainish, wood. Flavor is mild sour, woody. Light bodied. Dry finish.
